Lack enough support: The claim lacks evidence or support to back up the assertion that three million non-citizens voted illegally in the 2016 presidential election.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that three million votes were cast by non-citizens without providing any evidence or data sources to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts federal law, which states that non-citizens cannot vote in a presidential election.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the alleged number of illegal votes by stating that it was three million, without providing any credible evidence.
Falters at times: The claim falters by relying on tweets from an individual named Gregg Phillips without verifying the accuracy or credibility of the information he provided.
Understate: There is no evidence of any bias of understating in the provided claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide any alternative explanations for the alleged illegal votes.
